values:
Remember that fortune cookie I told you about? The one that says the near future holds a gift of contentment. Well, it turns out its bringing me a gift after all. One day after getting the fortune cookie, I found out that special girl that I was thinking about during my lunch hour is coming to California on wednesday! How sweet is that? I'll answer for you......That's pretty cool, Tony. Thanks, I know. I'm pumped. All weekend we've been playing board games.....a little Balderdash, Risk, Trivial Pursuit.....and I've been losing big. The reason is I can't concentrate is because I'm so happy. I feel over-joyed. I feel like I've just eaten a giant NY strip steak. I feel content for the first time in a long time. I don't care about my bills or car now. My brain is fixed on her. 

I've been listening to Ben Lee a lot lately. His music is great. I discovered him during a lunch hour when I went to Tower Records to listen to music instead of eat. I came home that night and bought his CD on my iTunes. His music is mellow and somewhat happy. He has the Elliott Smith sounds mixed with Jack Johnson lyrics. That's the best way to describe him. 

Its already 12:30! I have much laundry to do and even more prepping for wednesday. First I'm gonna eat that Pastrami sandwich from last night. I love food. The weekend was pretty darn good again. I stayed in Hermosa all weekend and we played volleyball for 6 hours yesterday. But have no fear, I don't burn. I'm just a toasty brown. Troy and I played some 2 on 2 yesterday against these guys. I love 2 on 2 volleyball. Its such a different game. There's more hustle involved and every hit is more important because you only have one person to hit it to. We ended up losing our best of 3 match but that's ok. Losing is the first step to success. That was my first time ever playing 2 on 2 and the guys we were playing are at the beach every weekend playing. I can only imagine Troy and I will get better. I think next week we plan on having a 2 on 2 tournament amonst our friends. That should be cool. Ok, I've gotta go, there's much to do.

Here's a small story I wrote at work today. Its dumb, but I wanted to pass the time. Its called LUNCH HOUR. Enjoy! 

I'm walking.....left, right, left, right, left, right......and here I am. The elevator is upon us. I'm saying us because you've gotta have someone with you on your lunch hour. If you don't eat with someone, you might be looked at weird. People will say "oh, look at him. He's sitting alone....loser". This elevator takes forever. There's people crowded in and wondering why I'm taking the elevator from the second floor to ground level. I bet I pissed off at least half of the people in this elevator. I wasted at least 12 seconds of their quality lunch time. Well, to answer their question as to why I'm taking the elevator to ground from two is easy. I'm just that damn lazy. Ok, time to go outside. I walk down Brand Boulevard this time. Stoplight. It's red. I can't go anywhere. As I sit here and wait for the international symbol for walk, I'm thinking of a girl. The problem is I can't stop thinking about this girl. When I look around I picture her there. I can't wait to see her and I have to try to block her out of my head. Finally! Mr. White Walk Guy says I can proceed. I have the right of way in this crosswalk. For the next 20 or so seconds, I can do what I want in this crosswalk. I could do a dance. I could sit down and wait for a cool breeze. Or maybe I can just stand and put out the vibe. Ooooh, if I stand maybe that Mercedes will hit me. I'm not hoping for death. Maybe just a broken wrist or arm or something. Stitches would be ideal actually. I don't want to deal with a cast. I just want something that will get me injured enough so that I can sue. Instead of standing to get hurt, I'm just gonna walk through. Now isn't the time to try anything flashy. 

Block 2 is a block I walk on all the time. There's always people coming and going from the 24 hour fitness. Its weird because its an office building. There's a guy wearing an awesome gray suit. I want it. I should ask him where he got it and how much. But I won't. Instead I'll mind my own business. I'll keep walking...lunch awaits me. There's a girl wearing spandex. There's a big muscular guy with arms bigger than my torso. Muscle men look so ridiculous. There's a business woman. She is very pretty. It makes me think of my girl. Dammit, I was gonna try not to think of her. I failed. There's a really skinny asian dude that needs to hit the weights or something. I'm no fine specimen but this guy is like a giant praying mantis....skinny arms, skinnier legs....you could probably snap his arm right now with a little pressure. That girl in spandex really doesn't need to work out. She looks good. I bet she's obsessed with herself. Ok, that's judging. She does look good though. Now there's a group of girls that should be in the gym! Crikey. I have to cross the street because there's road construction coming up. Thank you Mr. White Walk Guy, I will gladly walk through your intersection. If you were a person, I'd tell you that you're doing a great job giving pedestrians the right of way. But you're just a series of lights. Yes, I'm sorry to break that to you. It was a little harsh huh? My bad. I didn't mean anything by it. 

The next 3 blocks are always crowded. Look at all the suits and ties. Oh yeah, I'm one of those suits, aren't I? What time is it in Michigan? 3:17. Hmmmm....I wonder what she's doing. Oh great. Here we go. I hate this crap. We have a group of "environmentalists" that are trying to get me to donate some money to good Old Mother Nature. I slipped past one of them, but the one that's looking straight at me seems to know that I'm trying to avoid them like the plague. "Hello Sir" he says. "Would you like to donate a few bucks to save your environment?" Hmmm...no. But I play the cherade and act all nice to him. Everybody does. There's no point in being an ass to this guy. He's just doing his job. My job is to sit in an office and be a supervisor of our database. His job is to try to get people to donate $10 for nature. He has to know that there aren't going to be many people that donate. How would you like to go to your job knowing that people don't want to hear from you or waste their precious time on talking to you for five seconds. They just want to walk to and fro in peace with no interruptions. It would be nice to walk in peace. I should bring my iPod with me. Then I can just pretend that I can't hear them...and I'd get to listen to music. I could be even more anti-social and just bring my headphones and no iPod. I could put the ear pieces in my head and then just take the cord and put it into nothing inside my pocket. Nobody would be able to tell. Then I could still hear what was going on and I wouldn't have to interact becuase you know that people won't bother a man wearing headphones.  I respectfully tell the man "sorry, I have to get back to work" and I point in the opposite direction of my work. Boy did I fool him. I bet those people aren't even into saving Mother Nature. Some people call it hypocritical, I just call it survival. He probably needed a job and this was the best he could get right now. I bet he's an actor. Who isn't an actor in this town? I should stop and ask him what kind of car he drives. I bet its a gas guzzler. I wonder if he car pooled with his fellow salesmen. Did he donate $10 to save Mother Nature? All valid questions that I won't ask because lunch still awaits. 

Only 1.5 more blocks. God its hot. I hear opera music. Hold on. Nope. I don't see anything. Maybe its a car but it sounds like live opera music or a recording playing through speakers. That is so weird. I don't know where the music is coming from. I'm looking around and I can't put it together. There's a sign.....NO BIKES, NO SKATEBOARDS, NO ROLLERBLADES........bummer. What is the big deal about bikes, boards and blades? Apparently the sidewalks are too good for the harsh treatment that urethane wheels pound out. I guess maybe the city of Glendale is concerned that people are going to fall and sue. That has to be it. I wonder if there's a sick mind out there that would fall and break their wrist on purpose to sue the city of Glendale. It could work actually. There are bricks on the sidewalks here. I soon realize that the sign is just an insurance policy and not just a malicious prejudice act toward people on wheels. When signs are posted and someone gets hurt, its their own damn fault. But what if there was a blind person skating down the road. There's no way they could see that sign. They shouldn't be rollerblading in the first place but hey, its LA, it could happen. If said blind person fell and broke his/her wrist, I wonder if they could sue the city of Glendale. People sue for some pretty dumb things. The woman who's dumb enough to spill coffee on herself and blame it on McDonald's because the coffee was too hot. Hey genius, don't drink coffee, you drug addict. Caffeine is a drug, I learned that one playing trivial pursuit. Or better yet, you can drink as much coffee as you want just be careful and don't spill it on your lap. And she got like 1.2 million dollars for that...all for being dumb. This is America. I guess you can get rich doing anything and that's why people live here. 

Ooooh, finally. Here I am. I'm at the chinese fast food mecca of the world......Panda Express. I already know what I want....2 entree plate with steamed rice, orange chicken and tangy pineapple shrimp. And that's exactly what I order. Would I like to add soup or an egg roll? No, but thanks for asking. I appreciate the offer. I will take a pink lemonade though to quench that thirst of mine. God help you if you forget my fortune cookie. Soy sauce please. Can I have another packet? Awesome, thank you very much. Man, there's too many veggies with this shrimp. If I eat that onion, I'll be sick. Then I'd get to go home. But then I wouldn't get paid for 4 hours of work. There's always a catch. Chomp, chomp, chomp, chomp.....food is good. The lemonade is even better. It like an orgy in my mouth. Minutes pass and all I can think about is that fortune cookie. It looks so innocent there sitting on my tray. Little does it know that it will be eaten soon. If that cookie really had feelings, I wouldn't eat it. But luckily for me, I get to eat it. The best part is the fortune. I always think that fortunes aren't generic but they probably are. I like to think that some outside force controls the fortunes and you really do get something pertinent to your life. I crack the cookie in half. I smile to myself. "The near future holds a gift of contentment". All I have to say is final-fuckin-ly. June blew goats. You could say it was more gay than a bag of dicks. But this is good. This can only mean one thing. Either I'm going to get some money soon or my gal situation will finally come through. Ok, I've been here long enough. 

We move ahead to the walk back to the office. I decide to take Maryland Street back because I want to avoid all the peddlers and solicitors. I turn the corner and there's a homeless man that needs change. I like this guy. There isn't anything more sincere than a homeless person. This guy has seen a lot. Here's $5 brother. NO! God bless you my brother. Now I feel bad. This poor guy can't afford shit. I'm complaining daily because I can't afford to fix the brakes on my car. I complain that I make $480 per week. This guy would love to see that money. I should be more grateful. I'll save the complaining about my job for tomorrow. 

Crap. I thought I could avoid it, but they come out in droves. The environmentalists are back. Not the same crew I ran into on Brand, this bunch is different. I know exactly what to say......Oh, I already donated to your friends on Brand. That oughtta shut them up and it did. Success. They bought it. Holy shit! That opera music, I know where it came from. There is a lady in the median standing with her head phones on belting out opera. She's really good. I like it a lot. Everyone is staring but she doesn't care. I wish I could sing like that. I could be Tony the Tenor istead of Tony the Tiger. Maryland Street is a much more peaceful walk. There's more trees and more shade. There isn't the hustle and bustle of Brand. I can walk the rest of the way uninterrupted. This is how I like it. I'm starting to whistle. 

Still whistling..........

Man, that was much quicker of a walk. I'm back already. Time to get back into that elevator, swipe in and sit in my prison cell for 4 more hours. I know things could be worse. I could be mexican. Oh wait, I am.

Here's something I wrote in my notebook:

I sit here bored and waiting for Rylan to pick me up. I'm about to do something exciting. Tonight I get to pretend that I know aht I'm talking about. I got hired to shoot and light a music video and today is our first meeting. I've been in such a bad mood lately. Yesterday was depression but today was just  being pissed off....anger. I hate everything-my car, my job, my looks, my apartment, my clothes. I failed to tell you that my car got broken into last weekend. Maybe I did tell you and I just don't remember. The fuckers took my stereo and CD's. Lately I can't win. I can't do anything right. My life is one giant shit storm right now and I dont have an umbrella or pooper scooper. Being an adulte seemed like so much more fun about 10 years ago. When I saw Cinderella Man, it gave me hope, it inspired me but the inspiration only lasted a few days. The wind was takedn out of my sails when I gound my car trashed over. I don't know what to do now. I owe rent, I have past due bills and I need to get my car fixed. They say God only gives people what they can handle. Well, I muste be ont tough cookie because the month of June was probably the worst of my life. This feel good though, writing in a notebook. I need to do this more. I saw a commercial for a very pathetic show that grants people wishes. It's sad that we live in a society that only does other people favors or good deeds when the cameras are rolling. But that's the way it is. People don't do things because they feel it in their hearts, they do things because they want others to see how good of a person they are. That's why I like Oprah. She does things behind the scenes too, not just in front of the camera on her show. If there were more people like that around, this world would be awesome. But all people care about is themselves and that's fine. Who the hell am I to judge them? I'm just a nobody anyway.

All I can say is wow. I have a cousin that's 3 years younger than me and last week he had his first child. Well, he didn't really have it. His girlfriend did. That would be pretty hard for a guy to have a kid, technology hasn't reached that point yet. I wouldn't be surprised to see it one day though. I had a pretty good week. Work was work, it sucked. I saw a great movie...Cinderella Man.....first movie to make me cry halfway through it. I also saw a sneak peek of a terrible movie called Flightplan. Don't see it. It was terrible. Nate had a few friends in town this week and the other night we went to the strip club....that was interesting to say the least. Last night I got drunk in Hermosa and I'm going back there tonight to probably get drunk again. Other than that, its been the same old shit. I'll keep this one nice and short since I've been criticized many a time of writing too long of messages.

I said a lot of crazy things yesterday but eventually calmed the hell down. After I said all that stuff, good things started happening to me. I called Bria to hang out and she sounded like she really wanted to hang out. Right now I feel great. This is the best I've felt in a long time. I know that's gonna change tomorrow when I go into work but since 7pm last night I've felt great. I made plans to meet up with Bria around 10pm but I drove down to Hermosa around 7pm because Troy was having a handful of people over for a poker tournament. I knew I was gonna do shitty because I've only really played poker like 4 times but I always used to watch it on TV. Well, long story short, I won last night. I won almost $100. Troy made his garage into a total lounge area. He has 2 arcade games and a poker table  in there. Its not as cool as their last garage that had just about everything, but it looks nice and I anticipate many poker night in the future. I was shocked that I won but it felt really good. The people I played with have all been playing for a while and said I'm pretty damn good for a beginner. They said they kept trying to read me all night but they couldn't. Maybe I'm good at it because I know how to fool people.....in a good way. I've watched enough poker to know what the tells are. And I'd just act nervous with my chips or just have a really stern face when I play and that does the trick for me. I have to work on my head's up game though. I had an empire of chips at one point and it was Troy and I at the end and I nearly gave up my huge lead but then the God's smiled upon me and let me win. I kinda don't understand why people think poker is a skill game. Any dummy can tell you when you have good cards to play. Its all about luck. The only skill I can see is understanding how many cards are in the deck and what's been dealt and what your odds are. But that has nothing to do with natural skill. That's called mathematics. Luckily I'm quite the mathematician...or at least I used to be. I don't know though. The last IQ test I took said I was dumber than I was in high school. I'm still upset about it for some reason. Maybe its because I know I can do better. I know I got a 124 on my last test which isn't bad at all.....I just wanted to exceed the 130 I got out of high school. But today is a good day and I'll concentrate on that. Oh yeah.....forgot to finish up about last night. 

After my big poker win, it was time to meet up with Bria. I literally stumbled over to the bar......I drank a tad too much while playing poker. There was a huge line at the bar and I didn't feel like waiting a half hour. So I called her cuz she was inside and I told her to come get me. So she came out and explained to the bouncers what the deal was and because she's cute, they let me in. I hate all the Doumosa's at the bars. Oh, I guess I should clarify what a Doumosa is. A Doumosa is a term RC and I made up for guys that think they're so cool and impressive. These are usually the muscle bound guys that know how to pick up girls and get rid of them in 10 minutes. Ladies, you know the type because most of you fall for their crap. Well the derivation of the word Dumosa is from the Old English times. We simply combined the words Douche and Hermosa and there you have it....Doumosa. A Doumosa is a douche bag of Hermosa. This term can go with any other douche in any other city. For example, a Doucago is a douche bag of Chicago. I think you get the point. Anywho, I got into the bar and we sat with her and her roomies for a while and she wanted to show me her new place so I took her and Angela home. Her house is so awesome. Its so huge and really cheap for being in a beach town. I told her I was jealous. We stayed up for a few hours and just talked for a while. The next morning we continued our conversation and just chilled out for a while before I left back to my hell that is Burbank. 

Then I had to meet up with Rylan because we had to discuss this music video he hired me for. I'm actually gonna DP it!!!! I'm so pumped. This is my chance to do what I want to do....to prove to myself that I can do it. I know I can do it, but its going to be something else to actually be able to go out there, do my thing, work my lil behind off and light and film everything. It'll be cool, that's for sure. The song we're doing is pretty cool I guess. Music videos have been pumping in my veins for the past 2 weeks. There's a bunch of them on iTunes which I just watched and I'm inspired again. I watched my Spike Jonze and Michel Gondry dvd's for ideas, but nothing really struck. But now that I have a copy of the CD, it'll be a lot easier to brainstorm and think of cool ideas. The best thing about a music video is it doesn't have to make sense. Movies have a beginning middle and end with a character arc and things change, people change. But a music video can be a mouse eating cheese on a bed and it would make sense. 

And then there's some music I'm into. Obviously the new White Stripes is great. They will become my favorite band over time and more records. I'm going to see them at the Greek Theater in August. Then the new Coldplay is quite impressive. I don't think its as good as A Rush of Blood to the Head, but I think some of the individual songs on X&Y are so damn good.....particularly the songs "Fix You" and "Kingdom Come". I think "Fix You" is a song that I relate to and its a beautiful song. The lyrics remind me of my thoughts from when I got dumped. "Fix You" relates to my life like Eternal Sunshine did.....its just me. And right now I'm listening to Sufjan Stevens. I'm finally getting to import a lot of songs from Nate's collection that I've wanted to import into my iTunes. I need to still import the new Jack Johnson and some Sigur Ros and Radiohead. 

Just now I looked up the Cubs score and it wasn't a good trip out east to NY. They got swept by the Yankees. I hate the Yankees. People say I write too much on here. Well, if you've made it this far on this message, I really appreciate it and I'll stop right now.......just for you. Have a good night.

Yes. I know what it is!  I'm sitting here just staring at the ceiling (or at least I was) and it came to me. I feel like I'm going in reverse and everyone else around me is in the fast lane moving ahead. Dave and Amanda are engaged. Adam is engaged now. Speaking of which, I have a bachelor party to plan......I'm the best man. That just hit me. Adam is getting married. My best friend from high school is all grown up. He was the last one I thought would get married out of my circle of friends. He's getting married in Vegas though.....poor me. I have to plan a bachelor party in Vegas. I wonder if there's anything to do there for someone single in their ealry 20's. I'll have to think about that one. 

But back to my point......everyone is just going on with life. Everyone always thinks that I've got things figured out. I think I have my outlook on life figured out. Now I just need to live it. I guess I could also use some good luck but it just hasn't happened that way yet. I want a girlfriend. I miss it. I've been doing the single and mingling thing for quite some time now and its old. 

I have to put myself back in the driver's seat of life. I've been a passenger for a while. I've been drifting from place to place wondering what's gonna happen next. I have to make every opportunity happen. Things just don't happen on their own. What am I waiting for? Why am I so afraid of my potential? I've heard numerous times that my brain is too big for every place. But I don't believe that. But if so many other people believe it, why can't I? I haven't written a full lenght script because I'm scared. I'm scared of the outcome. If money is the only problem I face right now, why aren't I out doing what I know is right? Why am I afraid is what I'm asking. This is America. You can get rich being stupid. You can get rich being lazy. You can get rich buying things at garage sales and selling it for twice the cost on ebay. Look at ebay......that's a lazy, anti-social way of shopping. And the guy who thought of it is rich. Look at Jared from Subway. Although he's died down, all he was was a fat guy with a will to lose weight. And he got rich off of it. All you need is a spark, an interest in something that nobody would think of.....example: the guy that patented bubble wrap. He's one rich mofo right now. I'm only 2 steps away from total happiness......step one is gonna be finding a girl that loves me before I do something great....then the fun begins. This entry is crazy. I sound like a mad man. But I am a mad man. I'm being honest with myself. 

Its stupid wasting my time at a law firm. Everything comes so damn easy to me. I've been floating through life not reaching my potential because I'm scared. I don't want to release my brain on the world, but now I need to. Dumb, dumb, dumb is how I feel. This feels good though. This is a spark. Now I just need some logs and some gasoline to throw on the fire and I'll be set. Sitting at my cubicle at work has made me realize what I'm in this world for. I'm here to entertain. I'm hear to visualize. I'm not here to clock in, be a robot and type information into a computer. I'm here to make people laugh, cry, yell, puke (ok, maybe not puke), but you get the point. Its time to entertain again. This girl, this magical girl I speak of......I'll find soon. It could be someone I know, it could not. But something is gonna happen soon. I can feel that. 

On a lighter note, I forgot to mention that I saw Batman the other night. It was so good. I'm so very glad they started the franchise over with a good director. Christian Bale is perfect along with the rest of the cast. They're sticking to the comic book. Batman was always my favorite superhero and it was nostalgic sitting in that theater the other night with Nathan. I learned something about myself too. When I love a movie, I just sit. I'm a statue. I didn't move once during that film. My eyes were locked. It felt like I was the only one there watching the movie. Like Christopher Nolan made this film for me. That's how I felt when I watched Eternal Sunshine for the first time in theaters. I think that was really made for me by some higher power. If you experienced what I did at the time, you'd know. Batman is just so good though. I have to go.....i have to get to the bank before it closes.

I celebrated my 23rd birthday on the 15th. It was pretty damn good. I've gotta hand it to my friends here.....they know me. Its amazing how cool my friends here in LA are. I've become better friends with them than most of my friends back home. I guess that happens though when you move on through life and your friends are doing the exact same things they've been doing since high school. Nate organized a whole dinner for me. It was a small crowd of all the people that are closest to me (minus RC and Troy because they went to see Batman Begins instead). We went to this restaurant I've never been to before but that's the beauty of it.....it was new.....fresh....I had no idea where we were going. I thought they were gonna take me to Hooters, which would've sucked because their food isn't good at all. We went to this cajun restaurant and it was absolutely fantastic. I had blackened swordfish and it was to die for. Their gumbo was damn good too. I'm gonna have to hit that place up again. I got a little tipsy on a few drinks, but I'm allowed to because it was my birthday. Even the pianist at the restaurant sang happy birthday to me. After dinner we came back to my house and there was a plethorah of booze awaiting us. Nate, Ryan and I got pretty drunk while Summer, Amanda, Dave and Bria had to take it easy because of work......but that didn't stop me. It was my birthday. It was a fun time, definitely better than last year. I think last year was the worst birthday. This year my friends even bought me presents!!! I think I like the cards the most though because you get some interaction that you don't normally get to have with your close friends. Summer gave me a heart to heart card that meant a lot to me.....so did Amanda. Dave was silly old Dave. Here's Dave's message: "What can I say? Rock out with your cock out." That's perfect. Short, sweet and to the point. 

Right now I'm listening to the new Coldplay and its just as I expected.....great! This will be the first chance I get to listen to it from start to finish and that excites me. Speaking of great musical groups......The White Stripes are coming here in August. Tickets are only $45.....ok, tickets are $45!!! That would be the most I've ever paid for a concert but it'll be worth it. I've never seen any of my favorite bands in concert. The only problem is I might have to go by myself because I don't really know anyone that's into the White Stripes that lives here in SoCal. I'm sure I can find someone though. 

Last night I had a revelation.....again. I think that no matter what I do, I won't be happy. I'm already sick of my job. I thought the point of a job was to make you happy, but apparently that isn't the case. I don't know anyone that really likes their job. I'm sure if I was Steven Spielberg I'd enjoy it immensely, but I'm not. I'm Tony Garcia....a hollywood nobody. That reminds me of something I read in a book......."To the world she was nobody, but to me she meant the world"...... I just look at my last month and I'm amazed. It was a rollercoaster ride. But that's what life is. This sounds dumb but I never realized the power of money. I know it exists and how the economy works, but I never realized the power of it. Everything is money. Just about every important decision made is about money. I can't wait to get out of this money funk I'm in. Mentally I'm stable. I think negatively sometimes but if you had the month I had, you wouldn't be too happy with the higher powers either. Right now I have to get through this minor fork in the road. I have to get back into production ASAP but I have a good plan in the meantime. I have to get back on my feet with my robot job. Then once that's over, Hollywood is mine.

Last friday I finally quit my production job. I couldn't take it anymore at that place. I'm going to be back in production someday and I'm hoping that day is sometime soon. But right now I have to do what's right for Tony, which is me, and right now money is more important than my passion for being in the film industry. So I have a new job now. I work for a company called Atkinson-Baker Court Reporters. This is definitely the most weird place I've ever worked. First of all its run by Scientologists so their policies are pretty weird. My job interview went very well. First I sat and talked with the hiring supervisor named Mark and he really liked me. I showed him a bit of my humor but I was still professional about it. Then I took these weird tests. I guess they use these tests to screen out the dummies. I took an aptitude test, typing test, personality test and IQ test....it took forever to do but it was pretty fun. I got my results back right away which was nice. I've taken these tests before. I was most impressed with my typing test because I can type 75 words/minute which I hear is good. I guess all this time being online is paying off somehow. I was quite upset with my IQ test though. I took one right after high school ended because I thought it would be fun to know my IQ. I always thought I was pretty smart and it turns out I was. I got a 130 back in high school but my test this time wasn't as good. I got a 124. I was so mad and Mark was surprised at how visibly upset I was. But once he got the results from my personality test, he knew what my deal was right away. They called me in the next day for a second interview because the CEO of the company wanted to meet me. So I met him and he liked me too and told me they didn't have any openings.....but for the right person (he pointed at me while saying that) they would make a position. So they made a position for me at the company. They said they fell lucky to have a young man of my talents there. I don't know what that means. I don't take compliments very well. So long story kinda short I'm the new Client Database Supervisor. I'm already someone's boss. I'm the boss of many people actually. The older crowd there has got to hate me. Imagine a young 22 year old punk coming into your parents office and taking the job they were hoping to get promoted to....all because I took a few tests and showed a little personality at my interview. Not to mention, I get full benefits in 3 months which is awesome. Now, as good as all this sounds, I HATE IT! I always told myself I'd never get a regular 9-5 job. I wake up at the same time....arrive at the same time.....breaks are scheduled......lunch is scheduled......clock out time is scheduled. They train you to be a robot there and just live everything by a set schedule. I just hate it. I sit in my five by five cubicle prison every day with my shirt and tie and slacks and fake everything is ok just like everyone else around me does. Everyone arrives at the same time, everyone leaves at the same time. You can't come in early or leave late. You have to clock out at 5:30. You have to get permission to get paid overtime. I feel really bad for David right now. I mean really bad. Getting dumped isn't fun especially after you've been with someone for a year and a half. Apparently, that's going to be her living space for the next 2 months. It sucks seeing David like this. He's not very full of life in the first place but this is just ridiculous. I can look at him and know exactly what he's thinking. You just kinda get this blank stare and look off at nothing for extended periods of time...and all you do is think. You ask yourself constantly what you could have done to avoid this situation. You think of ways you can right the wrongs you've done. In some cases, there aren't really wrongs. Those are the worst cases. Knowing David's situation, he definitely could've done many things to stop this from happening. Everyone gets to a point where they're totally comfortable with someone and that's the moment when things start going downhill. He even told me the other night in his drunken stupor that he never thought Amanda would do this to him. Once you reach that level of comfort, you think you're set and you settle into this zone. Once you get in that zone, you don't think anything can happen to your relationship no matter what. I've been in that zone before and that's a huge part of the reason I got dumped in the first place. One year later, I don't care anymore, but I learned a valuable lesson. In this case it was simple.....all Dave needed to do was go out of the house every once in a while. Dave is a stay at home type of guy and Amanda is a lets go out type of girl. She put up with a lot of staying in on weekends over the past year and she was sick of it. Dave got to the point where he just sat in and expected her to do the same until they were old and grey. I also feel guilty for some of the stuff that is happening. I think she realized that she can have fun without Dave and gave him a few weeks to get his act together and he didn't....the rest is history. Then monday was the day they broke up. Things happen so fast. Now I'm just gonna be there for Dave because I know his situation so well. One day way down the road, he'll see this as a blessing. I thought Meghan was my everything and look where things are with us. I am in the position of power now. It took me 8 months to recover but I did and I'm a better, smarter person because of it. Yeah, fun. Yesterday was probably the most stressful day of my life. Well, at least the first part of it was. I haven't been getting good sleep for a long time. Actually its been over a year since the last time I slept truly comfortably. You see, I got used to this thing called a girlfriend. Going back to Dave and Amanda breaking up.....its weird and will be weird for quite some time. She's kinda taken a liking to one of our co-workers already. Its strange how quickly the bonds of trust can be broken. It takes less than a sentence for someone's trust bond to be broken. For Meg and I, it was broken once she said those famous words.....we need to talk.....nothing good ever comes out once those words are uttered. There was no one I trusted more than her. I shared everything with her. I told her thoughts that I wouldn't even tell my own mother. BM (before Meg) I had no problem trusting people. I'm a good judge of character and I usually can peg someone after meeting them in person the first time. But once she got rid of me, I had a hard time talking to anyone. I wouldn't share my feelings with my best friends. I would sit in my room and write or take my iPod for a long stroll around the city (Chicago). There were still some things that I couldn't tell Meghan but she basically knew everything about me. It wasn't until recently that I was able to trust people again. Like I said in my last entry, I'm over Meg. I know I've mentioned her name way too much in this, but she was a big part of my life, but that part of my life is over with now. I would still be her friend, but nothing more. I'm not saying I trust everyone now. I've found someone I can trust again though and its been a long time since I've had that feeling and its great to get it back. 

Now for today. Today was pretty cool. I don't have one complaint about work today. I actually liked my job today. Probably mostly because they had me doing assistant editor work. I got to log clips and digitize some footage for our Battle of the Bulge show. I know you don't have any clue what that is, but I'll try to explain....When you get footage you load it into the computers so it can be edited. Digitizing is when you load the footage into the computers in very large clips. Think of it as taking everything that's on the tape and making it into one giant clip and loading it from the tape and onto the computer. Now logging.....Logging is taking that massive clip and going through the footage and separating it by each take and taking the unnecessary footage out. That way when the editor comes in tomorrow, he'll have all the clips ready to go and labeled on the computer and he doesn't have to sort through all the garbage. So yeah, that's what I did today at work. Nothing too exciting, but it beats working a regular job. I also found out that I'm very respected at my work. Now that my foot is in the door, I just have to get to that next level. I'm figuring that out in my head as we speak...or type. I think that's all I really have to say right now. My brain hurts.

I don't know what to write about today. I haven't written anything in a while and it seems like there's nothing to say. I guess I could complain about work, but isn't that what everybody does? And then there was The Notebook. I don't know what it is about chick flicks and me lately. Maybe its because I've always been in touch with my feminine side....or perhaps its cuz I'm a momma's boy. But they just make me cry. All of them are pretty much the same story line and they all have the same outcome......nice, not so hot, poor guy gets girl over good looking, strong, rich guy. Now, I have no problem with that, but that isn't the way things go. And excuse me for this rant, but nice guys always finish last. Its a fact of life. I'm still trying to keep the faith in females, but it just hasn't been there. There are a few girls, mainly one, that give them all hope, but the verdict isn't in yet. Anyway, back to The Notebook....so 3 almost grown men decided to sit down on a sunday night to watch a chick flick together. We are all the sensitive type and we all pre-warned each other that tears might be shed. One of the first scenes reminded me of my first real date back in high school. My girlfriend at the time used to live 2 blocks away from me and one day I just walked over there and told her to get ready because we were going on a date. So she put some clothes on and all we did was walk around the neighborhood and run through people's sprinklers. It was so awesome. I know its not a real date, but I guarantee you that she will never forget it.  In the movie all they did was lay in the street after a movie, but it was random and I'm a pretty random guy I guess. The movie itself was good. I was on the verge of tears but I was able to hold back. Nathan however, couldn't hold back his tears. It sucks watching those movies because it makes me want to be loved again. I know many people love me, but I've been in love before twice and twice its ended in my heart being broken. I'm just sick of being alone. I have friends and I have family there for me but there's nothing like being with that special someone. I miss that. I feel like I've been ready for love since I was 16. I never went through that phase that many guys go through where they'd try to get with girls for the hell of it just to say they got some. I was always the one that was serious and ready. I thought by now girls would come around and realize that there are actual nice guys out there, but they haven't. I'm at a point where I don't know what to do anymore. I'm honest to everyone I meet. I don't think I'm that bad looking. I'm not super model, but I'm not totally hideous. What else do I have to do? Should I learn how to stand on my head? Juggle? What is it that women want these days? The answer isn't someone that's nice and caring and will treat them like a queen anymore. I'm afraid those days are gone. I don't know. Maybe I'm just bitter and lonely. I'm still trying though and I'll never give up til I find someone that understands me.....understands my humor.....wants to be with me.....and most importantly loves me for who I am. I don't ask for much at all, just love.

And speaking of love, Dave and Amanda broke up yesterday night. That was weird. They're both my good friends and not to mention we all live together so......things around the apartment could be getting weird. I can't say I'm shocked it happened, I'm just shocked it happened yesterday. I've been able to talk to Amanda a lot about it because I'm there for her and stuff and I know exactly what she's going through. We went to lunch today and I saw a lot of things in her that I saw in me from a year ago. When you're in love, it catches you and holds on and its great. But once its gone, it really hits you.....hard. There isn't a worse feeling in the world than losing someone you're in love with knowing they're gonna move on or they already have moved on to be with someone else. You aren't able to eat. You can sleep but its the worst sleep ever. You wake up every 10 minutes wanting that person or wanting to talk to that person you've lost. You sit and wonder why. Your stomach hurts and you feel like throwing up at the thought of your somebody with another person. That's another thing The Notebook reminded me of. When Ryan Gosling saw Rachel McAdams when he was on the bus and she went into the restaurant and kissed her new man, it made me think of my life. I've seen that before. Its really no fun at all. The adrenaline rush and anger is so captivating. There's no other way to possibly describe it unless you've experienced it first hand. I don't know what Amanda and Dave are gonna do from here. I'm in a tough spot because they're both my good friends and I don't want them to think I'm choosing sides. Breaking up is hard to do.

Speaking of breaking up.....my ex called me the other night. Guess who wants to get back together with me? I literally froze. I didn't know what to say. Its been a year almost to the day and she now wants me back. Its funny how our brains react in these situations because no matter how many times you plan things out and know exactly what you're going to say, it always catches you by surprise. Did I know she was gonna want me back??? Yeah, eventually. But we barely even talk. We just started talking regularly recently and she busted out with that shit. But my brain did exactly what I wanted it to do. I shot her down. I told her it wasn't possible for us to be together. I told her my life is new and different and she isn't a part of it. I can't believe I said that though. I thought for sure I was gonna choke and not be able to be at least a little mean about it. But my brain is right...I've moved on. For the first time in a long time I've realized that there are more girls out there. I'm ready for someone new. If I can find one girl.....just one.....that has the old school mentality, I'm in. I'm just glad I didn't let her get the best of me this time. I could've easily folded but she's just not for me. Its a breath of fresh air saying that and actually, truly meaning it this time. Before it was out of bitterness. I can think of her with other people and not give a damn anymore. If you've ever been there, you'll know what I'm talking about. I feel like there's a monkey off my back and I'm ready to go on.

And finally, I've typed way too much tonight. Dreams. Dreams are so awesome. Mine are fucked up beyond reality but I'm getting good at dreaming. Yes, you can get good at dreaming. If you think about something right before you go to bed, you'll dream about it. But now I'm getting to the point of having lucid dreams. I'm not talking about the movie Vanilla Sky either. I'm talking about being able to control what you do in your dreams. Its like you're awake but you're dreaming. You can think about what you want to do and literally make that decision in your dream. The best part is when you make a decision and you don't get the results right away. I probably sound crazy saying this but its so great. If you want to fly, do it in your dreams. I did it the other night. I was dreaming that I was in a Chicago skyscraper staring out the window and writing and I literally felt like I was sitting above myself watching myself write and I can remember thinking to myself in my sleep and I wanted to jump out the window and fly. But a few seconds/minutes (who knows how long it was) passed and I wouldn't fly. I just kept writing and thinking.....but then all of a sudden I got up and flew out the window. Its like dancing with your brain and its so amazing. I want to get to the point where I have a lucid dream every night. Humans only use something like 4% of their brain power and I think it would be amazing to figure out how to use more. Michel Gondry has a new movie coming out called The Science of Sleep and I think its about lucid dreams.....I'm gonna have to check it out considering he's the director of my favorite movie ever....Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind. 

Ok, that's enough for now. I can't go on. I mean, I can but I won't. If I do, I won't have anything to write tomorrow. How am I not myself?

This entry is about a guy that is amazing and lighting up the sport of football this year. His name is Peyton Manning. NEVER before have I been more impressed with an athlete in a single year. Tiger Woods had a hell of a year when he dominated the Masters Tournament. Golf is the hardest sport and Tiger showed what he was made of. He was having a rather mediocre game (by Manning's standards) and rightly so because he is up against the best defense in the NFL. Going into tonight's game he needed 2 touchdown passes to tie Dan Marino's record. He just threw his first TD pass of the game which is what prompted me to write about him. I love watching him play because he doesn't play like any other athlete. I grew up in Chicago and he's equivalent to what Michael Jordan was to basketball....just a phenomenal athlete that's completely ahead of his time. Watching him is like watching a conductor with an orchestra. He steps up to the line of scrimmage and reads what the defense is about to do. Then he changes the play and is usually right. I've never seen anything like it before. He studies and studies and studies other teams defenses and their weakenesses. He studies their tendancies on every down. He knows what his opponent is going to do before they even know what they're going to do. On top of being the smartest athlete in all the pro sports, he's a great guy. He doesn't have an ego. He does many charity fundraisers. He is always pleasant to the press and media even when his team loses. He cares about his fans and he cares about his teammates. But most of all, he loves the game and has respect for the game of football, which not a lot of athletes do these days. He may not get the all time record tonight against Baltimore but he will get the record eventually. And there's no one more deserving for this record than Peyton Manning. I'm not even a fan of Indianapolis but there's something about him that makes you like him even when he's kicking the crap out of your team...much like he did to my beloved Bears a few weeks ago. So cheers to Peyton Manning, one of the few good athletes left out there.

Sometimes I love my work....actually most of the time I love my work. But today was a good day. I did have to wake up at the ass crack of dawn (6am) because we had a shoot day today at the Gene Autry Museum right by the LA Zoo in Griffith Park. We had to film the interview sessions for our upcoming documentary on Jesse James. I don't know if anyone knows how those interviews work for documentaries, but I'll fill you in anyway because I have nothing better to do. Its usually a small crew (5-7 people) and there's a person off camera asking questions to the person on camera. Usually the person on camera is some kind of historian or history buff. I always thought that the interview subject had really short answers......this is not the case at all. Each interview session lasts about 50 minutes and the subject usually blabbers on and on and on. So since we were at a museum and I had 50 minutes between camera set ups, I decided to take a stroll around the museum and see what it had to offer. I was quite intrigued by all the cool stuff. I realized there's so much history to the US that I don't know about. Everyone can repeat what they learned in history class but you can learn a lot just by going to your local museum and just checking things out. It even made me want to learn some of my mexican heritage, which I've never been interested in knowing about. It was pretty cool being able to just walk around the museum like we owned the place. It was closed today but they let us come in so we could do our interviews and they didn't even charge us for filming.....that's unheard of in LA, or anywhere for that matter. Museums are pretty scary too...especially when you're in this huge place with only 5 other people. You see all these mannequins and they start to get scary looking after a while. Not to mention you're surrounded by the history of the US and you never know what items could be sacred. But yeah, that was my day......another day at the office. Now I'm tired and hungry and must get going.

This Thanksgiving was possibly the second worse day of my life, definitely in the top 5 worse days ever and I was gonna write about it on Thanksgiving but I didn't want to depress myself even more. The day started out just fine. I got up early to watch the football game. I ate a small breakfast. It was just like any other day. It was also the first time I was truly alone on a holiday. I come from a very close, tight family. We all live within 40 miles of each other and out of my whole entire family, I'm the only one that decided Chicago was too small of a place for me and my dreams. I'm a bit of a dreamer I suppose but I think I have the ability to do whatever I put my mind to. So now I'm here in LA, Burbank actually, and it was the first time I was without friends or family. Let me tell you......that isn't fun. I got through the first half of the football game just fine. Then at halftime the fun began to stop. I started thinking about how much I miss my family and how much I miss having fun with my friends. My friends here in LA are nothing like me. I wouldn't say I'm a socialite but I do like to be in social situations and mingle with people. I'm not the annoying guy that likes to be the center of attention at all times either. I go around and mind my own business but I like doing social things--bars, clubs, etc. Almost all of my friends here I met in film school and a lot of what we knew about each other we learned at school. I had my group of friends outside of school that I hung out with and partied with and I didn't really know most of the kids from my class outside of school. It was kinda like that high school thing....you had your core group of friends that you did everything with and there were your friends at school that you hung out with only at school but you still considered your friends. So that's where I'm at with them. I like going to bars. I drink. I like dancing and mingling. They drink too, they just like to get drunk at home and play video games which isn't my forte at all. So I started thinking about that. It doesn't help that 2 of my best friends from back home were here a week ago and we went out and partied the way I like to party. I got a taste of what I like again and I obviously liked it....a lot. So I missed my friends and fun and then I started to think of my family. Of course I called them and I basically talked to everyone in my fam because they do the same thing every year. So after I got off the phone with them I was like Ok, this is starting to get crappy. I thought it was gonna be a nice day to relax and enjoy my thoughts. Then the big kicker.......I started thinking about Meghan, my ex-girlfriend. Thanksgiving was always a big deal to both of us. We used to do our own thing and get ready together to meet up with both her family and my family. We were very much like a married couple except we weren't married. To top that off, she had a child of her own that I grew to love and think of as my own. Meg and I knew each other since 4th grade and we were great friends the whole time up until last February. So it was like a family was already started. We talked about marriage and everything was all planned out, including our engagement rings and her wedding dress.....but something went wrong somewhere along the way and long story short (I'm sure you'll hear more stories about her), she broke up with me. Boo hoo. So I thought about her and how only a year ago we had plans of marriage and I wondered how things could've gotten so bad in just a year. I knew she was back in Chicago for the weekend because her mom had told me she was coming back into town. Yes, her mom and I still talk. We became very good friends throughout mine and Meg's relationship. After many minutes of thinking about her I decided to take a shower because I thought maybe I'd forget things somehow. But then it just got worse. While I was shaving I just broke down. It was like everything hit me at once. I had trouble breathing. I started to cry. And I don't cry often, but when I do cry, I CRY! I consider myself a tough person and I know I'm a tough person. I can take a lot of pain and sorrow, but that day I just couldn't hold back. Maybe it was what I needed to get through the day or maybe it was just a way of dealing with my sadness. I guess that's a normal thing to do. When people are sad, they cry, so I cried. The rest of the day was just shit. From there on out all I could think about was the girl that I miss and love. There's one thing I can't stand and its when people say "get over it". Anyone who tells you to just get over it is either A) dumb, B)not a good friend, or C) they've just never been in true love. Losing someone that you've known for years, that was your best friend, the one person you could trust with anything......its very painful. Its not like I knew it was coming either. It was 2 days before Valentine's Day. The night before she broke up with me she still said she loved me and wanted to be with me forever. Its funny how fast things change. 24 hours later it was over. No more Meghan. No more Ciaran (her daughter). No more nothing. The one person I could trust with my life just betrayed me. Anyway, she isn't the point of this rant......You can't just drop someone out of your life. I don't care if its been 8 months now. I don't care how many people I make out with or have sex with, I can't get Meghan out of my head. I did for a period of about 2 days and for about 4 hours last night, but that's about it. Every other second of my days there's at least a nano-thought of Meghan. Sometimes there's just no way of harnessing your own thoughts. Anybody who thinks they have the answer to not thinking about someone you love, hasn't experienced love. Its just something that has to happen over time. I've accepted the fact that Meg and I can't be together right  now. There's just no possible way. Anyway, back to my turkey day. Other than me breaking down and crying and thinking about everything and missing everything, my day was pretty good. I ate my turkey sandwich with pride and joy. I watched my Chicago Bears lose again. That was a bad day that I don't want to relive again. Its a good thing I'll be home and with family for Christmas, but Christmas will be another struggle with the whole Meg thing because we had our traditions that I was a part of for the past three years and now I'm no longer part of the plan. I'm glad I waited until now to write this about my Thanksgiving. If I wrote about this on thursday, every other word would be fuck or shit or bitch and I would've been pretty bitchy. But now I'm fine and I feel better about things. I sometimes just slip up and think when I shouldn't, but you just can't help that. That is all for now.
